title: Drawing, "Stage Design: Palace Architecture", 1750–99
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and gray wash, black chalk on paper
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli: Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Design for a stage set.  A palace facade seen from the left angle and from below.  At left, stairs lead through a porch into a garden.  Pavilion to the right.  Pencil mark above, indicating a curve.

exhibitions.title: The Cooper-Hewitt Collections: A Design Resource

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Stage Design: Palace Architecture", 1750–99.
1750–99. Pen and black ink, brush and gray wash, black chalk on paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-36.
